intro: Manfreda jaliscana, commonly known as the Jalisco manfreda, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Peridiscaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, storing water in its thick, fleshy tissues. Manfreda jaliscana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
